intro: Arabis kennedyi, commonly known as Kennedy's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This low-growing perennial has basal leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. The plant is adapted to harsh conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
